026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.sources;
027
028import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext.ContextCheck;
029import com.ibm.streams.operator.OutputTuple;
030import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingOutput;
031import com.ibm.streams.operator.compile.OperatorContextChecker;
032import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.PrimitiveOperator;
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.types.Timestamp;
034
035/**
036 * Sample source operator that creates a tuple with random values
037 * and a timestamp.
038 * Extension of {@link RandomBeacon} that assumes the output schema
039 * has a <code>timestamp ts</code> attribute, and sets it to
040 * the current time when the tuple was submitted. All other attributes
041 * in the output tuple are set to random values by the parent.
042 * <P>
043 * This operator provided as the sample Java primitive operator
044 * <BR>
045 * {@code com.ibm.streams.javaprimitivesamples.sources.RandomBeaconWithTimestamp}
046 * <BR>
047 * in the sample {@code JavaOperators} toolkit located in:
048 * <BR>
049 * {@code $STREAMS_INSTALL/samples/spl/feature/JavaOperators}
050 * </P>
051 */
052@PrimitiveOperator(description="Sample source operator that creates a tuple with random values and a timestamp.",
053        comment=RandomBeaconWithTimestamp.IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT)
054public class RandomBeaconWithTimestamp extends RandomBeacon {
055
056    /**
057     * Check that the output port schema
058     * contains an attribute {@code ts} of
059     * type {@code timestamp}.
060     */
061    @ContextCheck
062    public static void checkTsAttribute(OperatorContextChecker checker) {
063        final StreamingOutput<?> port = checker.getOperatorContext().getStreamingOutputs().get(0);
064        checker.checkAttributes(port, false, "tuple<timestamp ts>");
065    }
066    
067    /**
068     * Use the parent-class's <code>fetchSingleTuple</code>
069     * and then overwrites the <code>ts</code> attribute's value
070     * with a current timestamp.
071     */
072    @Override
073    protected boolean fetchSingleTuple(final OutputTuple tuple) throws Exception {
074        
075        super.fetchSingleTuple(tuple);
076        
077        tuple.setTimestamp("ts", Timestamp.currentTime());
078        
079        // Always submit the tuple
080        return true;
081    }
082}
